problem.markdown:
>>Which of the following statements best captures the tradeoff between capital goods and consumption goods in economic growth? <<
(x) A society must balance the need for current consumption with the ability to consume more in the future. ( ) A society can consume as much as it can now without any impact on future consumption. ( ) Any increase in output will lead to economic growth because it allows a society to produce more goods and services today. ( ) Society's best strategy for promoting wellbeing is to allocate as many resources toward capital goods as possible today. ( ) There is no tradeoff between capital and consumer goods because both lead to an increase in economic growth
